Class SqlTextArea

  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.print.Printable, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.Scrollable, org.fife.ui.rsyntaxtextarea.SyntaxConstants

    public class SqlTextArea
extends org.fife.ui.rsyntaxtextarea.RSyntaxTextArea

    Utility class for setting up a SQL editor area with syntax highlighting and line numbers.
    This class extends org.fife.ui.rsyntaxtextarea.RSyntaxTextArea, which in turn extends JTextArea.
    That means it can be used by the application just as a normal JTextArea would, but this class also provides the utility method generateScrollPane(), that returns a JScrollPane with proper scroll bars and line numbers added, ready to be applied to the container.

    Example:
    JPanel panel = new JPanel();
    SqlTextArea sta = new SqlTextArea(20, 60);
    panel.add(sta.generateScrollPane());
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Hallgeir
    See Also:
    RSyntaxTextArea, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SqlTextArea

        public SqlTextArea(int rows,
                   int cols,
                   boolean dark)
        Sole constructor
        Note that this constructor adds support for line numbers, but the JTextArea itself does not have them. Use generateScrollPane if you want the SqlTextArea to have line numbers. As an utility, you can skip this constructor all together, and simply call the static factory method createSqlTextArea(int rows, int cols)
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the SqlTextArea
        cols - The number of columns in the SqlTextArea
        dark - If the color scheme should be dark, with bright text

    • Method Detail

      • generateScrollPane

        public javax.swing.JScrollPane generateScrollPane()
        Generates a JScrollPane, ready for use. See constructor for example of use.
        Returns:
        This object contained in a JScrollPane, with line numbers added.

      • createSqlTextArea

        public static javax.swing.JScrollPane createSqlTextArea(int rows,
                                                        int cols,
                                                        boolean dark)
        Generates a JScrollPane with a SqlTextArea ready to use within. This method simply calls the constructor and generateScrollPane() internally
        Parameters:
        rows - The number of rows in the SqlTextArea
        cols - The number of columns in the SqlTextArea
        Returns:
        a SqlTextArea object contained in a JScrollPane, with line numbers added.
